intro: Gonzalagunia pachystachya, commonly known as the Mexican candleplant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
